metadata.title: CVE-2014-3506 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
d1_both.c in the DTLS implementation in OpenSSL 0.9.8 before 0.9.8zb, 1.0.0before 1.0.0n, and 1.0.1 before 1.0.1i allows remote attackers to cause adenial of service (memory consumption) via crafted DTLS handshake messagesthat trigger memory allocations corresponding to large length values.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3506` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu7
openssl - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssl package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1f-1ubuntu7').
